markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Dybbuk](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2967)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The discorporated spirits called dybbuks arise from souls denied respite in the afterlife, often because they committed some great transgression in life. These spirits are said to cling to life through possessing victims to escape the punishment awaiting them in the afterlife. Only by trapping, cowing, or destroying such spirits can a mortal hope to drive them back.

 Dybbuks, who are most often the spirits of men, hide within possessed victims. Their targets of possession are usually young women on the eve of their wedding nights, which can be seen as an omen of an ill-fitting match, particularly in arranged marriages. Male and nonbinary victims do exist as well, though in lesser quantities, and also often on the eve of a troubled marriage. No one knows for sure why dybbuks are drawn to such situations, though it may be because the transgressive soul of a dybbuk seeks to bring chaos to the most strictly regimented aspects of society.

  A victim possessed by a dybbuk might be loud and crude, refuse to eat or drink, perform profane acts, or otherwise stir up trouble in the victim's household. The possessed victim has no memory of these events after their possession ends.

 Certain classes of specially trained priests can expel dybbuks from their victims through exorcism. Typically, this uses a methodology combining smoke, the blowing of a horn from a ram, and the recitation of holy verses. Exorcisms are, however, extremely difficult and dangerous, and require great knowledge and skill on the part of the priest due to the power of these malevolent spirits.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Spirit](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 36

**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 36

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Dybbuk.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 15">[Dybbuk](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2967)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Incorporeal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=632" />
<trait label="Spirit" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=737" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=722" />
<trait label="Unholy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=521" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 136 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +27; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +28, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +31, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +29, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +28

<row gap="medium">
**Str** -5

**Dex** +7

**Con** +0

**Int** +1

**Wis** +6

**Cha** +8
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 35 

**Fort** +21 

**Ref** +28 

**Will** +29 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 175
([void healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=83))

</row>

**Immunities**
bleed, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision, [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95)

**Resistances**
all damage 10 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737), or [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103))

**[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=64)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=542), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=590), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=598), [mental 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=647), DC 33) 

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** fly 50 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
ghostly hand +28 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)),
**Damage** 3d10+14 void plus 2d6 spirit

**Occult Innate Spells** DC 36, attack +30
- **Cantrips (6th)**
[Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334)
- **3rd**
[Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110) (at will)
- **4th**
[Rewrite Memory](/Spells.aspx?ID=1655)
- **5th**
[Chilling Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=36) (×2), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110)
- **6th**
[Dominate](/Spells.aspx?ID=87), [Never Mind](/Spells.aspx?ID=1614), [Telekinetic Maneuver](/Spells.aspx?ID=333) (at will)

**Malevolent Possession** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Possession](/Traits.aspx?ID=129)) The dybbuk attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the [_possession_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1638) spell (DC 34) with an unlimited duration, except since the dybbuk doesn't have a physical body, they aren't [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95), and aren't [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85) when the effect ends, though they take 5d6 spirit damage if the body is knocked unconscious or killed. If the dybbuk took control of the target with Malevolent Possession, when the dybbuk departs, the target has only incoherent memories of the interval it was possessed.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Cruel Puppet Masters</title>

Dybbuks revel in tricking mortals and using their telekinetic abilities to sow fear in the hearts of those around them. They create chaos in the households of their victims using their innate magical abilities. Victims possessed by dybbuks are often controlled indefinitely, until the dybbuk becomes bored with them or until some brave soul finds a way to release the victim from their torment.
</aside>
